required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tomographic Assessment on the Influence of the Placement of a Collagen Membrane Subjacent the Sinus Mucosa After Maxillary Sinus Floor Augmentation
clinical_study.official_title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography Assessment on the Influence a Collagen Membrane Placed Subjacent the Sinus Mucosa After Maxillary Sinus Floor Augmentation. A Randomized Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of the study is to look for differences in dimensional variations of augmented maxillary sinuses with or without the placement of a collagen membrane subjacent the sinus mucosa.

detailed_description.textblock: After the elevation of the maxillary sinus mucosa, a collagen membrane with standard dimensions will be placed at the test sites subjacent the sinus mucosa and the elevated space will be filled with a xenograft, both test and control groups. A collagen membrane will be placed to cover the antrostomy at both groups and sutures will be provided to close the wound. CBCTs will be taken for all patients before surgery (T0), after 1 week from sinus floor augmentation (T1) and after 9 months of healing (T2). Dimensional changes over time of soft and hard tissues will be evaluated on the CBCTs.

study_design_info.masking_description: An author not involved in the surgeries will perform the randomization process. The assignments will be sealed within opaque envelopes that will be opened after the completion of the elevation of the sinus mucosa.

primary_outcome.measure: Changing in height of the elevated zone
primary_outcome.time_frame: The CBCTs will be taken before surgery (T0) and 1-week (T1) and 9 months (T2) after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Measurements will be assessed in the medial, middle and lateral regions of the elevated zone using the cone beam computerized tomographies (CBCTs) taken in various periods.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The CBCTs will be taken before surgery (T0) and 1-week (T1) and 9 months (T2) after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements will be assessed in the cone beam computerized tomographies (CBCTs) taken in various periods. Comparisons among the CBCTs of each participants will be performed.

arm_group.description: The sinus mucosa will be elevated and, at the test sites, a collagen membrane will be placed subjacent the sinus mucosa
The sinus mucosa will be elevated and, at the control sites, a collagen membrane will not be placed subjacent the sinus mucosa

intervention.description: Maxillary sinus augmentation procedures have become increasingly popular procedures before placement of dental implants in posterior maxillae that have suffered severe bone loss due to sinus pneumatization, alveolar bone atrophy, or trauma.
intervention.other_name: maxillary sinus lift, maxillary sinus elevation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- presence of an edentulous atrophic zone in the posterior segment of the maxilla
- height of the sinus floor ≤4 mm
- desiring a prosthetic restoration of the zone using a fix prosthesis supported by implants;
- ≥ 21 years of age
- good general health
- no contraindication for oral surgical procedures
- not being pregnant
Exclusion Criteria:
- present a systemic disordered
- had a chemotherapic or radiotherapeutic treatment
- are smokers >10 cigarettes per day
- have an acute or a chronic sinusitis
- had a previous bone augmentation procedures in the zone of interest.
